implicit:
含蓄的，不直接言明的，默示的 
understood though not clearly or directly stated
disproportionate:
不成比例的 
having or showing a difference that is not fair, reasonable, or expected; too large or too 
small in relation to something
sublunary:
月下的，地上的；尘世的 
situated beneath the moon; of or pertaining to the earth, earthly
demoralize:
使泄气；使意志消沉；使士气低落 
to make somebody lose confidence or hope
rout:
溃败 
a confused and disorderly retreat from a place
duly:
适当地 
in the proper or expected way

如期地 
at the correct or expected time
laudatory:
赞美的，颂扬的 
expressing or containing praise
affront:
侮辱，冒犯 
to do or say something that shows a lack of respect for (someone or someone's feelings)
hysterical:
歇斯底里的 
feeling or showing extreme and uncontrolled emotion 
44
censor:
审查 
to examine books, movies, letters, etc., in order to remove things that are considered to be 
offensive, immoral, harmful to society, etc.

审查员 
a person who examines books, movies, letters, etc., and removes things that are considered 
to be offensive, immoral, harmful to society, etc.
avarice:
贪婪 
a strong desire to have or get money 
45
frontier:
国境 
a border between two countries

边远地区，尚待开发区域 
a distant area where few people live
solemn:
庄严的，严肃的 
very serious or formal in manner, behavior, or expression
docile:
驯服的 
easily taught, led, or controlled
quaint:
奇特的；古色古香的，古雅的 
having an old-fashioned or unusual quality or appearance that is usually attractive or appealing
hover:
鸟、直升机等翱翔；盘旋 
(of birds,helicopters, etc.) to stay in the air in one place

踌躇，彷徨 尤指在某人身边 
(of a person) to wait somewhere, especially near somebody, in a shy or uncertain manner

靠近某事物；处于不稳定状态 
to stay close to something, or to stay in an uncertain state
metropolis:
大都会；大城市；首都；首府 
a large important city (often the capital city of a country or region)
predisposition:
倾向， 易患某种疾病的体质 
the fact that someone is likely to think or behave in a particular way, or likely to develop a 
particular medical condition
disagreeable:
不愉快的 
not pleasing; unpleasant or offensive
dexterous:
手灵巧的 
having or showing great skill or cleverness; showing dexterity
ingest:
摄食；摄取 
to take (something, such as food) into your body; to swallow (something)
fuss:
大惊小怪；小题大做 
a show of flattering attention
elated:
兴高采烈的 
very happy and excited 
46
plunder:
尤指战乱时用武力抢劫，掠夺 
to steal things from a place, especially using force during a time of war

抢掠；掠夺 
the act of plundering 
n.( ) 尤指战争中掠夺的财物 
things that have been stolen, especially during a war, etc.
consensus:
一致意见，共识 
a general agreement about something; an idea or opinion that is shared by all the people in 
a group
seedling:
刚出芽的幼苗 
a young plant that is grown from seed
recollection:
回忆，回想 
the act of remembering something or the ability to remember something
dissipate:
驱散；消散 
to separate into parts and disappear or go away

浪费金钱、时间、努力等 
to use all or a lot of (something, such as money or time) in a foolish way
majestic:
宏伟的，壮观的 
large and impressively beautiful
rational:
理性的 
based on facts or reason and not on emotions or feelings

有理数 
something rational specifically; rational number
elude:
躲避 
to avoid or escape (someone or something) by being quick, skillful, or clever
brevity:
简洁 
the quality of being brief

短暂 
the quality or fact of lasting only for a short period of time
severity:
严厉，严峻 
the quality or condition of being severe
endorse:
公开支持；赞同 
to publicly or officially say that you support or approve of (someone or something) 
47
clamber:
手脚并用爬 
to climb or crawl in an awkward way
strife:
冲突 
very angry or violent disagreement between two or more people or groups
antics:
复数名词滑稽动作；愚蠢行为；古怪举动 
foolish, outrageous, or amusing behavior
plague:
瘟疫 
a disease that causes death and that spreads quickly to a large number of people

困扰 
to cause constant or repeated trouble, illness, etc., for (someone or something)
utter:
完全的；十足的；彻底的 
used to emphasize how complete something is

出声；说；讲 
to make a sound with your voice; to say something
quaver:
声音因紧张或害怕而颤抖 
(of a person's voice) to shake or tremble in speaking, typically through nervousness or emotion
edible:
可食用的 
suitable or safe to eat
impetus:
推动力，促进因素 
a force that causes something (such as a process or activity) to be done or to become more active
vocation:
工作，职业 
the work in which a person is employed
resemblance:
相像，相似 
state of being alike, similarity; point of similarity; image, likeness
circumstantial:
指描述详细的 
providing or including the details of a particular situation or event

证据 间接的；佐证的 
pointing indirectly toward someone's guilt but not conclusively proving it
screen:
筛查 
to examine (people or things) in order to decide if they are suitable for a particular purpose
antitrust:
反垄断的 
protecting against unfair business practices that limit competition or control prices 
48
impeach:
弹劾 
to charge (a public official) with a crime done while in office
dissolution:
解散，解除，注销 
the act of officially ending a marriage, organization, agreement, etc.
suffocate:
使窒息而死 
to die because you are unable to breathe
envision:
想象 
to think of (something that you believe might exist or happen in the future); to picture 
(something) in your mind
incidental:
附带发生的；次要的；非有意的 
happening in connection with something else, but not as important as it, or not intended

作为自然结果的；伴随而来的；免不了的 
happening as a natural result of something

附带的次要事情 
something that happens in connection with something else, but is less important
balmy:
温暖舒适的（天气等） 
(of weather) pleasantly warm
somber:
忧郁的 
very sad and serious

昏暗的 
having a dull or dark color
slant:
斜坡 
a direction, line, or surface that is not level or straight up and down

观点 
a peculiar or personal point of view, attitude, or opinion
decomposition:
分解 
the process of decay that takes place when a living thing changes chemically after dying.
terminate:
使终结 
to cause (something) to end
overstep:
超越正常或允许的范围；越权；践越 
to go beyond what is normal or allowed
spike:
金属钉状物；尖锥；细长的尖状物 
a long, thin rod that ends in a point and is often made of metal

价格、数量的突然上升，剧增 
a sharp increase in the magnitude or concentration of something 
49
reprehensible:
应被斥责的，应被谴责的 
very bad; deserving very strong criticism
dilated:
膨胀的 
wider or further open than usual
nondescript:
无特色的 
not easily described; having no special or interesting qualities, parts, etc.; typical and uninteresting
weighty:
重大的，严肃的 
very important and serious
blissful:
极乐的；幸福的 
extremely happy; showing happiness
prod:
戳 
to push someone or something with your finger or a pointed object; poke

刺 
something (such as a long stick) that is used to prod an animal
forthcoming:
即将到来的 
appearing, happening, or arriving soon
abate:
使 减弱，减退，减轻，减少 
to become less strong; to make something less strong
commemorate:
纪念 
to exist or be done in order to remind people of (an important event or person from the past)
acquiesce:
默许，勉强同意 
to accept, agree, or allow something to happen by staying silent or by not arguing
dissuade:
劝阻 
to convince (someone) not to do something
instigate:
煽动；唆使；鼓动 
to cause something bad to happen

使 正式 开始；使发生 
to make something start or happen, usually something official 
50
flashback:

往事的闪回

you feel that you are living through the experience again
outright:
立刻的，直截了当的 
quickly and completely; not gradually

完全的，彻底的

discrepancy:
差异，不一致

decency:
礼貌，得体

extravagance:
奢侈，挥霍
